ygData.subject: Re: Do you WANT to be a twink??
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I m not gonna say a word about twinking anymore. Got called a dumb newbie over on Everlore s Rogue discussion board for voicing my opinions on the
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I'm not gonna say a word about twinking
anymore. Got called a "dumb newbie" over on Everlore's
Rogue discussion board for voicing my opinions on the
subject. <br><br>So, no more, except for this one last
thing (!). It is a matter of roleplaying, I think
(don't worry, shooman, I still like you and like reading
your posts). Dang, it's really hard to verbalize this
. . . OK, I have a Dwarf Paladin, 2nd level, who's
currently camped next to the guards in Butcherblock. My
Dwarf Rogue, meanwhile (main character, now 11th level)
came across a bitchin' Fine Steel Great Staff. He
can't use it, and it would be very easy to drop it for
the Paladin and a very cool item for her. But I don't
want to do that, because there's no "logical" reason
for her to find it, in the context of the game. It
would be contrived, and that would take away from the
purity (integrity?) of my Paladin . . . Actually, I
_could_ rationalize it -- I actually think of them as
brother and sister . . . <br><br>But for every item that
my Rogue has, there's a story behind it that I
remember, even those items given to me by others (which
they call "handouts," not "twinking," on Everlore).
Like the Gnome who gave me the Tailored Whip and said,
"Go kill something with it, I want to see it in
action." Or the fact that I bought my Dwarven Banded Mail
with the proceeds from selling a Lambent gem that I
got for guiding a High Elf through
Butcherblock.<br><br>I suspect this isn't making sense. <br><br>But
maybe that's it -- roleplayers are perhaps less likely
to twink, or at least twink in a less grandiose
fashion. Like the guy (54th level Druid) who's going to
buy Ravenscale or Rygorr (sp?) for his new Gnome
Rogue. Good gosh, I don't even have any idea what that
stuff is. Most people don't roleplay (shooman does, I
know from these boards), let's admit it, so it's a
case where many folks want to be able to play the game
more effectively, more quickly. Twinking allows
that.<br><br>So, OK -- if that's your gig, go ahead and twink. My
gig is (role)playing a character, and filling out the
story of his life. To each his own.<br><br>Kharlisht of
Kaladim<br>11th level Rogue<br>Drinal<br>Who will never speak of
twinking again . . .
